solution_line_template: Gondor was able to repair a total of {phones_monday}+{phones_tuesday}= <<{phones_monday}+{phones_tuesday}={total_phones_repaired}>>{total_phones_repaired} phones from Monday to Tuesday.
And the total amount he earned is ${earnings_per_phone}x{total_phones_repaired}= $<<{earnings_per_phone}*{total_phones_repaired}={earnings_from_phones}>>{earnings_from_phones}.

He was able to repair a total of {laptops_wednesday}+{laptops_thursday}= <<{laptops_wednesday}+{laptops_thursday}={total_laptops_repaired}>>{total_laptops_repaired} laptops from Wednesday to Thursday.
So, the total amount he earned is ${earnings_per_laptop}x{total_laptops_repaired}= $<<{earnings_per_laptop}*{total_laptops_repaired}={earnings_from_laptops}>>{earnings_from_laptops}.
Therefore, the total amount he earned is ${earnings_from_laptops}+${earnings_from_phones}= $<<{earnings_from_laptops}+{earnings_from_phones}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings}.
